alert.note: Alert for Fleming; Menifee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 12:09PM EST until February 16 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 PM EST, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Around 2 inches of rain has already fallen across the warned area, with another 1 to 2 inches of rain expected through tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Morehead, Stanton, Flemingsburg, Owingsville, Frenchburg, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Wellington, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Fairview, Peasticks, Polksville, Olympia, Craigs and Slate Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
